HR VOLUNTEER ASST. MANAGER
Professional Summary
I am dedicated to every project I have worked on with strong undergraduate and graduate credentials including five years experience in Assisting Management of Human Resources.
I look to expand my knowledge increasing chances of future career opportunities by completing a Doctorate in business program.
Educating myself as a full time student puts me in the position to operate in industries such as Manufacturing, Government, and Healthcare, those industries alone would increase my earning potential.
Being educated in these aspects of business will help me operate any organization as needed with my Masters Degree in Business Administration, along with being able to comprehend what is needed for the organization to succeed.
My aspiration while completing this MBA program is helping me allow myself to work in top management positions along with allowing me to show the skills gained through education.

Knowing how to get any product or service to receiving location on time is another aspect of the key points learned during my undergrad education learning about Entrepreneurship.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Human Resources Director

Location: Santa Barbara, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Human Resources, Other

Description:
Compensation: $150,000-200,000 base salary
Our client is looking for a seasoned and results-oriented HR executive to join the team as the Director of Human Resources. The Director of HR will play a pivotal role in shaping the organization's human capital strategy, fostering a positive workplace culture, implementing transparent and efficient HR processes and systems, and ensuring compliance with all employment laws and regulations.
Responsibilities
Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the organization's overall mission, goals, and objectives.Collaborate with senior leadership to drive workforce planning, talent acquisition, and employee development initiatives.Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues, ensuring fair and consistent application of policies and procedures.Foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture that values diversity and promotes employee engagement.Oversee the recruitment and onboarding processes to attract and retain top talent.Develop and implement strategies for employee retention and professional development.Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations.Mitigate HR-related risks and implement proactive measures to maintain a compliant and ethical work environment.Implement and manage performance evaluation processes to drive employee development and organizational success.Provide guidance and support to managers in performance management and employee feedback.Implement and manage strategic talent development programs and initiatives that align the talent strategy to the organizationâ€™s strategy.Implement and manage efficient, accessible and user-friendly processes and systems to empower employees and managers with all HR activities.Collaborate with finance to ensure the financial sustainability of HR programs.
Qualifications
5+ years in a strategic Human Resources Leadership roleBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree or HR certification preferred (example: SPHR or PHR)In-depth knowledge of HR principles, employment laws, and best practices.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build positive relationships at all levels.Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.Demonstrated ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.Proficiency in HRIS and Microsoft Office Suite.
Compensation
$150,000-200,000 base salary

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
